sentences: Shin Hyo-seob (Korean: 신효섭; born May 3, 1992), professionally known as Crush (크러쉬), is a South Korean R&B and hip hop singer-songwriter and producer.
section: N/A

sentences: Crush often uses Jazz musical instruments in his style of music, implementing modern tunes.
section: N/A

sentences: He debuted on April 1, 2014, with the single "Sometimes" and  released his first album Crush on You on June 5, 2014.
section: N/A

sentences: Thirteen of Crush's singles have peaked in the top ten on the Gaon Digital Chart, with nine of Crush's singles also becoming top five hits including "Just", "Beautiful", "Don't Forget", "Bittersweet" and "Sleepness Night".

== Life and career == | === 2016-2018: Breakthrough and widespread recognition ===
== Life and career == | === 2016-2018: Breakthrough and widespread recognition ===

sentences: Breakthrough and widespread recognition ===
section: == Life and career == | === 2016-2018: Breakthrough and widespread recognition ===

sentences: In January 2016, Crush released the single "Don't Forget" featuring Girls' Generation's Taeyeon.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016-2018: Breakthrough and widespread recognition ===

sentences: "Don't Forget" won first place on Show Champion on January 27, marking his first music show win.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016-2018: Breakthrough and widespread recognition ===

sentences: Crush also went on to win Best Vocal Performance - Male Solo at the 18th Mnet Asian Music Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016-2018: Breakthrough and widespread recognition ===

sentences: In 2016, Crush became an active member of the hip-hop crew Fanxy Child, consisting of Zico (rapper, producer), Dean (singer, producer), Penomeco (rapper), Millic (DJ, producer), Staytuned (producer).
section: == Life and career == | === 2016-2018: Breakthrough and widespread recognition ===

sentences: In July 2018, Crush released his third extended play Wonderlost.
section: == Life and career == | === 2016-2018: Breakthrough and widespread recognition ===

sentences: As with his previous projects, Crush was heavily involved in the songwriting, composition, and production of his album, stating: “I’m able to do the full production… I can make my own arrangements, and oversee the entire process.”In
section: == Life and career == | === 2016-2018: Breakthrough and widespread recognition ===

sentences: December 2016, Crush also released the hit OST “Beautiful” for the tvN drama Guardian: The Lonely and Great God, and later received a nomination for Best OST at the 19th Mnet Asian Music Awards.

== Life and career == | === 2019: Second full-length album and continued popularity ===
== Life and career == | === 2019: Second full-length album and continued popularity ===

sentences: Second full-length album and continued popularity ===
section: == Life and career == | === 2019: Second full-length album and continued popularity ===

sentences: On June 4, 2019, Crush stated on his Instagram that he would be leaving Amoeba Records to start his own agency.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019: Second full-length album and continued popularity ===

sentences: However, on July 17, 2019, he announced that he had decided to sign with PSY's agency P Nation.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019: Second full-length album and continued popularity ===

sentences: On December 5, 2019, Crush released his critically acclaimed second full-length album From Midnight To Sunrise, with "Alone" and "With You" serving as the album's double title tracks.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019: Second full-length album and continued popularity ===

sentences: Crush once again took control of songwriting and production for the album, and introduced jazz elements alongside R&B.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019: Second full-length album and continued popularity ===

sentences: From Midnight To Sunrise won R&B Album of the Year at the Korean Hip-hop Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019: Second full-length album and continued popularity ===

sentences: In February 2020, Crush released the OST “Let Us Go” for the tvN drama Crash Landing On You.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019: Second full-length album and continued popularity ===

sentences: In May 2020, it was announced that Crush had asked Joy of Red Velvet to feature on the title track of his new album.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019: Second full-length album and continued popularity ===

sentences: The song "Mayday" topped multiple music charts upon its release.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019: Second full-length album and continued popularity ===

sentences: On October 20, 2020, Crush released his fourth extended play With Her.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019: Second full-length album and continued popularity ===
